title: Tzedakah
summary: Tzedakah or Ṣedaqah (Hebrew: צדקה‎ [ts(e)daˈka]) is a Hebrew word meaning "righteousness", but commonly used to signify charity.[1] This concept of "charity" differs from the modern Western understanding of "charity." The latter is typically understood as a spontaneous act of goodwill and a marker of generosity; tzedakah is an ethical obligation.
